section.title: Environment Variables
section.para: Clutter automatically checks environment variables during its initialization. These environment variables are meant as debug tools, overrides for default behaviours or to address known hardware issues:

listitem.para: Forces the text direction of every Pango layout inside Clutter. Valid values are: ltr or rtl
Prints out the frames per second achieved by Clutter.
Sets the default framerate.
Disables mipmapping when rendering text.
Enables "fuzzy picking".
Enables debugging modes for Clutter.
Enables debugging modes for COGL.

section.para: On the GLX backend there is also:

listitem.para: Selects the sync-to-vblank mode to be used. Valid values are: none, dri or glx

section.title: Command Line Arguments
section.para: Similarly to the environment variables, Clutter also installs command line switches that are parsed during initialization:

listitem.para: Equivalent of CLUTTER_SHOW_FPS. Prints the current rendering speed in frames per second.
Equivalent of CLUTTER_DEFAULT_FPS. Sets the default framerate.
Equivalent of CLUTTER_TEXT_DIRECTION. Sets the direction for the text.
Equivalent of CLUTTER_DISABLE_MIPMAPPED_TEXT. Disables mipmapping when rendering text.
Equivalent of CLUTTER_FUZZY_PICK. Enables "fuzzy" picking.
Equivalent of CLUTTER_DEBUG. Sets FLAGS as the Clutter debugging flags.
Unsets FLAGS from the Clutter debugging flags.
Equivalent of COGL_DEBUG. Sets FLAGS as the COGL debugging flags.
Unsets FLAGS from the COGL debugging flags.

section.para: The X11 backends also have the following command line options:

listitem.para: Sets the X11 display to use.
Sets the X11 screen number to use.
Make X11 calls synchronous.

partintro.para: The GLX backend also has the following command line option:

listitem.para: Equivalent of CLUTTER_VBLANK. Sets the sync-to-vblank method to be used.

section.title: Debug flags for Clutter
section.para: The debugging flags can be used for the CLUTTER_DEBUG environment variable and the --clutter-debug command line switch. Multiple flags can be separated by a colon (:).
